document.contentSummaryTitle: 9 ways to make your midweek easier
document.contentSummary: Clever hacks to save you time.
document.pageMetaDescription: How to prep meals like a pro! Find delicious make-ahead recipe ideas and clever culinary hacks here.
document.contentBody:
[{"type":"paragraph","label":"Paragraph","content":"Wednesday night [dinner](http://www.womensweeklyfood.com.au/recipes/search/dinner|target="_blank") doesn't have to mean a mad dash to the supermarket for ingredients and inspiration.

With a little prep you can streamline your midweek to-do list, crossing off those chores — like grocery shopping and prepping lunches — early. Suddenly you have more time to enjoy mealtimes rather than stressing over what to cook.

Sound good? Here, nine clever culinary shortcuts to make midweek a doddle..."},{"type":"heading","label":"Heading","content":"1. Chop, chop, chop"},{"type":"image","label":"Image","content":{"source":"","credits":[],"tags":[],"url":"http://d3lp4xedbqa8a5.cloudfront.net/s3/digital-cougar-assets/food/2018/05/07/1525674934528_chicken-zoodles.jpg","valid":true,"width":1178,"height":978}},{"type":"paragraph","label":"Paragraph","content":"Prepping veggies is often the most time-consuming part of making dinner.

Get a head start by chopping, slicing or spiralizing double the amount in one go. 'Zoodles' will stay fresh in the fridge for three to five days, while carrots and capsicum are good for a week in a sealed container.

[Sesame crumbed chicken breast with lemon zoodles](http://www.womensweeklyfood.com.au/recipes/sesame-crusted-chicken-breast-with-lemon-zoodles-32671|target="_blank") is your new Wednesday night hero."},{"type":"heading","label":"Heading","content":"2. Add a twist to a family favourite"},{"type":"image","label":"Image","content":{"source":"","credits":[],"tags":[],"url":"http://d3lp4xedbqa8a5.cloudfront.net/s3/digital-cougar-assets/food/2018/05/03/1525308313776_chicken-and-veggies.jpg","valid":true,"width":1178,"height":978}},{"type":"paragraph","label":"Paragraph","content":"Growing tired of those fuss-free kid-friendly dinners you cook week in, week out?

Try adding a new ingredient to the mix for a fresh take.

[**South Cape Tasmanian Fetta**](http://www.southcape.com.au/our-range/fetta-and-goats-cheese/|target="_blank"|rel="nofollow") is seriously versatile. It's Danish-style Fetta cheese made in Australia from 100% Tasmanian milk. Pair with prosciutto for a twist on chicken and veggies, add to frittatas or sprinkle on top of pizza. Just make sure there's enough for seconds!"},{"type":"heading","label":"Heading","content":"3. Make your oven work harder"},{"type":"image","label":"Image","content":{"source":"","credits":[],"tags":[],"url":"http://d3lp4xedbqa8a5.cloudfront.net/s3/digital-cougar-assets/food/2018/05/07/1525675619509_salad.jpg","valid":true,"width":1178,"height":978}},{"type":"paragraph","label":"Paragraph","content":"Still batch boiling eggs for snacks and salads five at a time on the hob?

Time to swap the saucepan for a muffin tin and turn on the oven. Make a dozen in one go by baking for 30 minutes.

Just be sure to do a test run first to ensure you've got the correct temperature."},{"type":"heading","label":"Heading","content":"4. Batch make lunch"},{"type":"image","label":"Image","content":{"source":"","credits":[],"tags":[],"url":"http://d3lp4xedbqa8a5.cloudfront.net/s3/digital-cougar-assets/food/2018/05/16/1526427583840_quiche.jpg","valid":true,"width":1178,"height":978}},{"type":"paragraph","label":"Paragraph","content":"While the oven is on for those eggs, buy yourself even more time by prepping lunch for the week.

These individual [pumpkin, South Cape Tasmanian Fetta and basil quiches](http://www.womensweeklyfood.com.au/recipes/pumpkin-feta-and-basil-quiche-12527|target="_blank"|rel="nofollow") take next to no time to prep and will see you through 'til Friday.

Save yourself even more time by using shop-bought pastry."},{"type":"heading","label":"Heading","content":"5. Dig out the slow cooker"},{"type":"image","label":"Image","content":{"source":"","credits":[],"tags":[],"url":"http://d3lp4xedbqa8a5.cloudfront.net/s3/digital-cougar-assets/food/2018/05/07/1525676121117_papperdelle.jpg","valid":true,"width":1178,"height":978}},{"type":"paragraph","label":"Paragraph","content":"And not just for melt-in-the-mouth [pappardelle with slow-cooked beef ragu](http://www.womensweeklyfood.com.au/recipes/pappardelle-with-slow-cooked-beef-ragu-32568|target="_blank"). Finish the dish with a sprinkle of [South Cape Parmesan](http://www.southcape.com.au/our-range/parmesan/|target="_blank"|rel="nofollow") for the ultimate midweek comfort food.

Your slow cooker is the ultimate multi-tasker. Not only can you batch boil eggs, but it's also the best way to cook beans, prep pizza dough, make no-nasties granola and even serve up the ultimate cup of hot chocolate."},{"type":"heading","label":"Heading","content":"6. Prep chicken in one go"},{"type":"image","label":"Image","content":{"source":"","credits":[],"tags":[],"url":"http://d3lp4xedbqa8a5.cloudfront.net/s3/digital-cougar-assets/food/2018/05/07/1525676866249_chicken.jpg","valid":true,"width":1178,"height":978}},{"type":"paragraph","label":"Paragraph","content":"Chicken is a midweek staple, but chopping and seasoning quickly gets tiresome. That's where this ingenious hack comes in handy!

Next time you're making a stir fry or salad, slice enough chicken for three meals. Season three different ways then cook in a pan with an aluminium divider to stop the flavours from mixing.

That's lunch and dinner sorted."},{"type":"heading","label":"Heading","content":"7. Liven up leftovers"},{"type":"image","label":"Image","content":{"source":"","credits":[],"tags":[],"url":"http://d3lp4xedbqa8a5.cloudfront.net/s3/digital-cougar-assets/food/2018/05/03/1525309761013_feta-salad.jpg","valid":true,"width":1178,"height":978}},{"type":"paragraph","label":"Paragraph","content":"We've all taken leftovers to work only to leave them in the fridge come lunchtime and head off in search of something more exciting.

The trick is to make last night's dinner taste like a new dish.

Pack a homemade dressing to liven up your plate. Or crumble your new favourite ingredient, fetta, over salads. Suddenly your lunch is the envy of the office."},{"type":"heading","label":"Heading","content":"8. Blend a no-waste smoothie"},{"type":"image","label":"Image","content":{"source":"","credits":[],"tags":[],"url":"http://d3lp4xedbqa8a5.cloudfront.net/s3/digital-cougar-assets/food/2018/05/07/1525678627801_smoothie.jpg","valid":true,"width":1178,"height":978}},{"type":"paragraph","label":"Paragraph","content":"Where would we be without that all important morning smoothie?

But when you're running out of the door and haven't got time to measure out ingredients, it's easy to end up with way too much.

Save time and money by prepping your smoothie mixture on a Sunday morning. Then freeze for the week ahead."},{"type":"heading","label":"Heading","content":"9. Grab some skewers"},{"type":"image","label":"Image","content":{"source":"","credits":[],"tags":[],"url":"http://d3lp4xedbqa8a5.cloudfront.net/s3/digital-cougar-assets/food/2018/05/08/1525735899288_chicken-skewer.jpg","valid":true,"width":600,"height":500}},{"type":"paragraph","label":"Paragraph","content":"Skewering fish or meat means perfect portion sizes, cooked just right every time. And it's so quick to do.

All you need is three or four large metal skewers (they'll withstand the oven better than the wooden ones). Cut salmon, chicken, beef or lamb in to chunks and marinade in your choice of sauce, we're big fans of this super easy [capsicum sauce](http://www.womensweeklyfood.com.au/recipes/skewers-and-capsicum-sauce-29865|target="_blank").

Leave in the fridge to soak up the flavour until you're ready to cook."},{"type":"related-content","label":"Related Content","content":[]},{"type":"heading","label":"Heading","content":""}]
